task-wr.title: Identifying the Software Version and Patch Level Using the CLI
task-wr.shortdesc: You can view the the current software version and patch level from the CLI. The system type is also shown.

context.p: To find the software version from the CLI, use the system show command. ~(keystone_admin)$ system show +------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +------------------+--------------------------------------+ | name | 57409bbc-c85c-4dbf-9eeb-49ee925c4cdf | | system_type | Standard | | description | None | | location | None | | contact | None | | software_version | 16.00 | | uuid | c6977e1e-49da-4ed2-8c3d-7ec201d45613 | | created_at | 2016-04-13T21:30:38.042086+00:00 | | updated_at | 2016-04-13T21:30:40.429541+00:00 | +------------------+--------------------------------------+
To list applied patches from the CLI, use the sw-patch query command.

codeblock.systemoutput: Patch ID Release Patch State ========================= ======= =========== SAMPLE_PATCH_15.06_a 15.12 Available

context.p: For more about working with patches, see
